document.ModsDocTitle: The Doryctinae (Braconidae) of Costa Rica: genera and species of the tribe Heterospilini
document.docAuthor: Marsh, Paul M., Wild, Alexander L. & Whitfield, James B.
document.masterDocTitle: The Doryctinae (Braconidae) of Costa Rica: genera and species of the tribe Heterospilini

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Doryctinae (Braconidae) of Costa Rica: genera and species of the tribe Heterospilini

subSubSection.paragraph:
Heterospilus romani Marsh
sp. n. Figure 104

Top label (white, printed) - Costa Rica: Puntarenas [;] ACO, R.F. Golfo Dulce [;] Golfito, Estacion Agujas [;] La Bonanza, 495m; second label (white, printed) - 15 Sept.-15 Oct. 1999 [;] J. Azofeifa, Malaise trap [;] L.S. 276000-526550 [;] # 53487; third label (red, partially printed and hand written) - HOLOTYPE [;] Heterospilus [;] romani [;] P. Marsh. Deposited in ESUW.
1 â™€, COSTA RICA, Puntar. [;] Golfo Dulce, 24km W. [;] PiedrasBlancas, 200m [;] III-VI-90 Hanson (MICR).
The granulate metasomal terga, at least at base, and the single cross carina in the prescutellar furrow are distinctive for this species.
Named for A. Roman who described numerous Neotropical braconids in the early 1900s.

caption.paragraph: Figure 104. Heterospilus romani Marsh, sp. n., holotype.
